subject: Sales
title: The Rise of Currency
description: Learn The Rise of Currency in one minute.

hook.text: King Croesus of Lydia minted the first standardized coins around 600 BC. Commerce was transformed.

buildup.text: Currency eliminated barter's inefficiency. Anything could now be priced, compared, and exchanged easily.

discovery.text: With money came price anchoring. For the first time, sellers could frame value against a number.

twist.text: Currency created a new role: the money changer. Middlemen have existed since the first coins appeared.

climax.text: Money didn't just simplify trade. It invented pricing strategy, discounting, and the concept of a deal.

punchline.text: Currency didn't just enable trade. It invented pricing.

quiz.question: What sales concept did standardized currency make possible?
